definition: son of the boss/young master of the house/your son (honorific)
few/less/to lack/to be missing/to stop (doing sth)/seldom

sentences.english: Then Master Linton has forgot the first injunction of his uncle,' I observed: `he bid us keep on the Grange land, and here we are off at once.'

sentences.english: He had many an anecdote of the gilded youth of his time.

sentences.english: But the landlord had already accepted the proposal of the young master surnamed Ma, a son of a rich family.
sentences.chinese: 可祝员外早已把女儿许配给了有钱人家的少爷马公子。

sentences.english: Young main in the yard, small left directly go in nice.

sentences.english: Being a chef, I really did it up right — brats and potato chips.

sentences.english: Master Heathcliff, much irritated, asserted her relation was false.

sentences.english: 'Well, my dear, I hear that he's a very rich young man from the north of England.
sentences.chinese: 啊，亲爱的，我听说他是个阔少爷，英格兰北部人。

definition: eldest daughter of an affluent family/(polite) your daughter/bossy or indulged young woman/Miss High and Mighty
son-in-law (used by wife's family)/uncle (husband of father's sister)
son of an official/son of nobility/your son (honorific)
young lady of the house/wife of the young master
girl/servant girl/(used deprecatingly, but sometimes also as a term of endearment)
(dialect) form of address for one's wife/polite form of address for a woman
